address

Class AddressBook

  • java.lang.Object
    • address.AddressBook

  • public class AddressBook
extends java.lang.Object
    Purpose: The class is used to represent an address book and it's many entries
    Since:
    Oct 14, 2015, JDK 8
    Version:
    2.0
    Author:
    Jesus Ramos

    • Constructor Summary

      Constructors 
      Constructor and Description
      AddressBook()
      Creates an empty address book with no entries in it

    • Method Summary

      All Methods Instance Methods Concrete Methods 
      Modifier and Type Method and Description
      void clear()
      Purpose: Clears the entire AddressBook
      void close(java.lang.String filename)
      Purpose: Used to save all the data in addressBook into a file named filename.
      AddressBook find(java.lang.String searchTerm)
      Purpose: Searches contacts for entries that have keys that contain the key given to the function as searchTerm.
      java.lang.String[] getKeys()
      Purpose: Used to get an array of all the keys in the contacts-TreeMap
      void insertAddress(AddressEntry newAddress)
      Purpose: Used to add new entries into the address book

      Purpose: Used to check whether or not the address book is empty

      Purpose: Prints out a list of all the entries in the address book
      int numOfContacts()
      Purpose: Used to get the number of contacts in the address book

      Purpose: Reads in all the contacts from a file.
      AddressEntry remove(java.lang.String key)
      Purpose: Removes the element tied to the given key
      AddressEntry removeFirst()
      Purpose: Used to retrieve and remove the first entry in the address book

    • Constructor Detail

      • AddressBook

        public AddressBook()
        Creates an empty address book with no entries in it

    • Method Detail

      • insertAddress

        public void insertAddress(AddressEntry newAddress)
        Purpose: Used to add new entries into the address book
        Parameters:
        newAddress - a blank entry with no data in it

      • isEmpty

        public boolean isEmpty()
        Purpose: Used to check whether or not the address book is empty
        Returns:
        whether the address book has no entries

      • clear

        public void clear()
        Purpose: Clears the entire AddressBook

      • numOfContacts

        public int numOfContacts()
        Purpose: Used to get the number of contacts in the address book
        Returns:
        the number of contacts in the address book

      • removeFirst

        public AddressEntry removeFirst()
        Purpose: Used to retrieve and remove the first entry in the address book
        Returns:
        the entry that was just removed

      • remove

        public AddressEntry remove(java.lang.String key)
        Purpose: Removes the element tied to the given key
        Parameters:
        key - a string containing the key to the to be removed object
        Returns:
        true if the entry was successfully removed, false if otherwise

      • getKeys

        public java.lang.String[] getKeys()
        Purpose: Used to get an array of all the keys in the contacts-TreeMap
        Returns:
        the keys in contacts

      • find

        public AddressBook find(java.lang.String searchTerm)
        Purpose: Searches contacts for entries that have keys that contain the key given to the function as searchTerm. It collects these entries in a new AddressBook object, and passes it back to where the method was called.
        Parameters:
        searchTerm - a string that carries a last name/partial last name that is used to search and identify a matching key within contacts
        Returns:
        an AddressBook object with the search selections in it

      • list

        public void list()
        Purpose: Prints out a list of all the entries in the address book

      • read

        public int read(java.lang.String filename)
         throws java.io.IOException
        Purpose: Reads in all the contacts from a file. It throws an exception if the file does not open. Otherwise it loads up the addressBook instance up with AddressEntry objects
        Parameters:
        filename - contains the name of the file
        Returns:
        the number of entries entered during the current read in.
        Throws:
        java.io.IOException - if the file does not successfully open

      • close

        public void close(java.lang.String filename)
           throws java.io.IOException
        Purpose: Used to save all the data in addressBook into a file named filename.
        Parameters:
        filename - the name of the file that all the data will be saved into.
        Throws:
        java.io.IOException - if the file does not successfully open
